docs.lead_paragraph: What began as a warning strike by coal miners here in the grimy, smoke-choked forge of Siberia has developed into a nationwide action with a simple demand: Out with Mikhail S. Gorbachev, his Government and his Parliament. The move began on March 4 as a modest one-day walkout in support of miners in the Ukraine striking for more pay. But then workers from the Bolshevik Mine on the outskirts of Novokuznetsk declared that they were staying out and that nothing would change until the "center" -- a reference to the central Government -- was disbanded.

headline.main: Strike by Soviet Miners Spreads In Rising Challenge to Kremlin
